intro: Annesorhiza refracta, commonly known as the brittlestem arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence consisting of a spadix and a spathe. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and wetlands. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. Annesorhiza refracta is adapted to wetland environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in riparian areas.
